firstDay.print: Aleksandra: I know you’re new and all, but that is no excuse for stupidity.
Aleksandra: I can't afford to train you super well, so pay attention.
((She's not lying... Paying attention to her is very important.))
((I mean, she does get a bit narcissistic but you will need to listen!))
Aleksandra: Basic rooms are $30. They're most common.
Aleksandra: Every time we have a new customer, make sure that you
Aleksandra: make use of that PC of yours and enter them into our bookings.
Aleksandra: Also - make sure you assign them to the right room.
Aleksandra: Basic rooms are 1-4, premium are 5-8, and luxury are 9-12.
Aleksandra: Some people will ask you all kinds of weird things.
Aleksandra: Just do your best to make them happy, and I'll be happy.
Aleksandra: Don’t forget to be nice to that weird chick.
Aleksandra: You'll probably run into her last - she's kinda quiet.
Aleksandra: For some reason she always visits this dump.
Aleksandra: If you ever forget, a bunch of information
Aleksandra: on the rooms is available in your PC.
Aleksandra: Try not to burn the place down.

secondDay.print: Aleksandra: Hey! Good job yesterday, keep it up kid.
Aleksandra: Today we are trying to get rid of our extra shampoo so
make sure you don’t give anything else out.
Aleksandra: Also - the longer a customer stays, the more they save!
Aleksandra: They get a 10% discount for more than 3 nights.
Aleksandra: ALSO! I'm going out with Romeo today so it looks like
Aleksandra: you're in charge! Don't screw up! You're well trained, right?
Aleksandra: Bahaha, who am I kidding- good luck!

thirdDay.print: Aleksandra: Hey, you’re doing a pretty okay job so far.
Aleksandra: I'll be honest, most of my employees lose it when I go out with
Romeo but you seem much cooler than all of those losers.
Aleksandra: Either way, I’m paying for you to be the best of the best so
strive to make me some more money, yeah?
Aleksandra: Anyways, today we are focusing on getting rid of conditioner.
Hear that? It's like you don't pay attention. CONDITIONER.
Aleksandra: Nothing else (!!!) should be given out. Don’t screw up.

fourthDay.print: Aleksandra: Hey, so something happened in the laundry center.
Aleksandra: We are short on pillows!!
Aleksandra: So, do NOT hand out the pillows!
Aleksandra: We need to keep some for my good night sleep you know.
Aleksandra: Anyways, keep up the work and make me money.

fifthDay.print: Aleksandra: Here’s your daily status update from your greatest boss.
Aleksandra: Today we’re trying to get rid of soap!
Aleksandra: They’ve just been getting old, and starting to smell weird.
Aleksandra: So try your best to get rid of them ASAP!
Aleksandra: The last thing I want is a repeat of last year.
Aleksandra: ALSO. DO. NOT. GIVE. OUT. TOWELS.

sixthDay.print: Aleksandra: I don’t really expect my employees to last this long.
Aleksandra: You’ve almost been here for an entire week.
Aleksandra: But make sure you don’t screw up the policies.
Aleksandra: Today we’re focusing on blankets!
Aleksandra: … They’re starting to smell weird too.
Aleksandra: And who’s that weird guy sleeping in your room?
Aleksandra: Actually, I don’t want to know.
Aleksandra: Also, there’s a toilet paper shipment coming in today.

seventhDay.print: Aleksandra: Anyways, you’ve been here for a full week now!
Aleksandra: There are no actual policies for you today.
Aleksandra: So I’m going to stop wasting my time and go.
